comment.author: 85718330@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92943860@N00] ART....do you know where Kidahi is?

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content:
No, I have an old road map of Tanzania from the mid 1960s and I can't find it on there either. It may be a misprint or the name has morphed a bit since then.

Looking again-from the description on the other photos this looks like it is also part of the construction of the "New Road" and other images are of the Ruaha Gorge which is near Iringa  (roughly south central Tanzania). So I imagine it is near there-maybe part of what is now the Ruaha National Park.

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: I think I have it. There is a tiny place called Kidachi which is near a river (a tributary to Ruaha?) which is roughly half way between Iringa and Dodoma

comment.author: 85718330@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92943860@N00] Excellent research work! These old photos are great!

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: I think it is brilliant that the National Archives are putting so many of these wonderful images on flickr

comment.author: 85718330@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92943860@N00] Yes, it was a delight looking through them. If only there were some records of year, location etc. Would cut out the guess work in certain cases.
